285570743.Author: Izzy Pin
285570743.Text: Does anyone feel like the electric scooter and motor bike situation is out of control? The motor bikes have no plates! Not to mention they are driving dangerously! Cutting people off on their blind side, going around vehicles who are making a turn, and other very reckless behavior! The electric scooter situation I understand doesn‚Äôt need license plates but why are they allowing motor bikes and and vespa-like scooters on the streets with no plates?! I almost hit a guy when he went around me as I was turning. I was making a right turn and he was making the same right and he came on my side as I was turning to make the right! Very close call! It‚Äôs absurd no one has done anything about it. They ride right pass cops in squad cars with nothing done!

285766245.Author: Deirdre Beck
285766245.Text:
My bestie and I went out for a Chinese lunch on Tuesday, Tasty House.. closed on Tuesdays!! Drove into Bronxville to try Hamlet , cute place, didn't want a burger and nothing else inspired us to stay (dark, heavy), even the folks outside looked grumpy, so we left there. Still had 1 hour and 1/2 on the meter, so we walked a bit and landed at Opa.. Greek restaurant. Wow! We had an awesome waitress , Ishelle (Michelle without the M), shared a spinach pie (spanakopita) and a chicken souvlaki plate. 2 yummy chicken skewers, pita corners, a pile of fries and tzatziki sauce. A Salad came with it. Absolutely yummy!!
On corner, great for people watching.

285828578.Author: Hudson Valley Writers Center
285828578.Text:
The Hudson Valley Writers Center is thrilled to host debut novelists Richard Mirabella & Ben Purkert on Sunday, August 20, 4 PM ET in person & on Zoom! 

Richard Mirabella's BROTHER & SISTER ENTER THE FOREST (Catapult, March 2023) is a New York Times Review Editors' Choice, as well as a Most Anticipated Book of the Year by Salon, Vulture, Chicago Review of Books, and LGBTQReads. 

Ben Purkert‚Äôs THE MEN CAN'T BE SAVED (Overlook Press, August 2023) "is an experience that transcends the act of reading fiction. It is an indictment, a call to self-examine, and ask questions, but it manages this while still being playful, lighthearted, and generous." ‚Äî Hanif Abdurraqib

More praise for the novels:

"Richard Mirabella's debut novel, Brother & Sister Enter the Forest, is an eerie, psychologically devastating novel by any measure, but it's Mirabella's careful, emotionally honest rendering of the ever-shifting relationship between older brother, Justin, and younger sister, Willa, that marks this book as a revelation." ‚Äî Christopher Bollen, The New York Times Book Review

"A brilliant skewering of modern-day masculinity. Wildly gripping, charmingly funny, bone-hard, and real. Purkert is the kind of writer whose work I'll follow anywhere."‚Äî Kaveh Akbar

Please join us, & share!

285546044.Author: Judy B.
285546044.Text:
I regularly see posts concerning No-Fault. Many people have a complete misconception of what No-Fault actually is. 
No-Fault, aka PIP (personal injury protection) has been mandatory in the State of NY since 1974.
No-Fault was designed to pay promptly, regardless of who is at fault or whether there was any negligence, for ECONOMIC LOSSES (meaning medical/health expenses, lost earnings, and certain other reasonable and necessary expenses related to injuries sustained), up to $50,000 per person ("basic No-Fault coverage"), to the driver and all passengers injured in YOUR CAR as well as any pedestrians injured by YOUR CAR. 
In no-fault states, auto insurance companies pay out claims filed by their respective policyholders to cover personal injuries after an accident. Who was at fault is irrelevant.
Florida, Kansas, Hawaii, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, North Dakota, Pennsylvania, Kentucky and Utah are the states with no-fault car insurance laws. 
All no-fault states include PIP as part of their minimum car insurance requirements. The only exception is Pennsylvania, where you only need medical payment coverage. No-fault states also place restrictions on your right to sue for injuries. You must meet the threshold of what qualifies as a ‚Äúserious injury‚Äù.

285628537.Author: Katie Schlientz
285628537.Text:
***LOST DOG***
Harper is still missing and we have received no sightings since 6:30 PM on Wednesday, when she first took off from Paws on Fifth in Pelham (she is a bit fluffier than in the photo). Last seen at the end of River Avenue in Pelham. (Close to Mount Vernon and New Rochelle)

1. We are going to walk around and post flyers today, further into New Rochelle and Mount Vernon just in case she is on the move.
2. ***We are asking everyone who has a Ring doorbell to check the videos to see if there are any sightings so we can track her location.
3. We are asking everyone on the border of Pelham near the Chester Park area to check under their deck and in their backyards for small spaces she can curl up. She is a fearful dog, so I want to believe she is curled up somewhere hiding. She is only 7 lbs so she can find small spots.
4. We are offering a reward, no questions asked, for her return. 

If you see her, please do not chase. Please call my phone number listed on the flyer or the Pelham/New Rochelle Police Station.

285550055.Author: Nancy Protzman
285550055.Text: Today my aide and went to the Pondfield Cafe on Pondfield Rd. W.  I hadn't been there in several years.  They have a large menu and you can get practically everything.  We had huge hamburgers and crinkle fries.  They were just as good as I remembered.  No dessert, which is unusual for any restaurant.  The only cautions I have are:  Cash only and no public restroom.  The place is clean and the owner, Maureen and waitstaff are friendly.  Great for breakfast too.

285583541.Author: Libby Hollahan
285583541.Text: Hi Bird fans, I will never be able to spot or photograph the birds like our wonderful member Joe De Marte does, but I have the Merlin app, and identify birds through sound recordings.  For the past couple of nights, I've listened to the Eastern Screech-Owl.  Recommend this app for anyone who wants to know about the various bird calls in your neighborhood.  Merlin is the app name connected to the Cornell Ornithology Lab, which has a huge database of everything to do with birds.

285801659.Text:
"Hudson Valley residents affected by the flash flooding in our region on July 9 are eligible for up to $2,000 towards mortgage, rent, or hotel expenses due to displacement."

"Assistance is available to qualified applicants towards one of the following options:

"Monthly mortgage expense for the primary residence that was damaged by the Flooding Disaster.

"Rental cost due to displacement from the primary residence resulting from the Flooding Disaster.

"Hotel reimbursement due to displacement from the primary residence resulting from the Flooding Disaster."

285542686.Text: UPDATE: Toot-ah (as the folks whose house I trapped in front of call her) was seen by a vet today. She received fluids, was snap tested - negative for all, had blood and dental work done. Apparently the major problem was a few bad teeth that started accumulating hair and ended up with a big hair ball around them. She had a few teeth extracted. She‚Äôll be spending the weekend indoors with an amazing experienced foster and will be returned to her stomping grounds next week. If anyone wants to make a donation to Friends of Mount Vernon, they covered her bill -

285666570.Author: Daniel D.
285666570.Text:
I'm interested to get opinions on people who have recently done HVAC / insulation projects on their home and have spoken to ConEd-certified contractors who can offer NYSERDA rebates along with non-certified contractors.

The certified contractors I've spoken to seem to be more pushy on the size of the project and what is necessary to qualify for the rebate, meaning the total cost even with the rebate is larger.

It's also unclear to me if the prices of everything have just raised $8000 (given a rebate of $8000) since the beginning of the year. Have these rebates even helped the bottom line for homeowners at all? Should I be talking with more local business that are not necessarily ConEd-certified?

Thanks!

285579118.Author: Matt Sullivan
285579118.Text: Today, LMC Media Center received the keys to our new space at Mamaroneck Cinemas, where we will begin building a video podcast studio for the community. This will serve as a platform for media education and creation, a place where all voices can be heard, and as always, an opportunity to continue to build community through media. Thank you to everyone who has supported us and allowed us to serve Larchmont and Mamaroneck for the past 40 years. Here‚Äôs to another 40!

285622484.Author: Marie Velasco
285622484.Text:
Hi! My name is Marie Velasco. I am a stay at home mom of 2 boys ages 11 and 6 years old. I was a Preschool Teacher for 17 years at my country before my family migrated here in 2018. During the pandemic, I taught my youngest son and prepared him for Kindergarten. I previously took care of a child. His parents entrusted him to me when he was 6 months old until he was 23 months old. They bring their sweet boy to my house. Sadly, the family transferred to a different town.

If you are looking for someone to take care of your child, I am and will be available by September or earlier. 

If you are willing to bring your child to my home, message me. Do not worry because my previous employer can attest that your child is safe with me and will be treated as part of our family. üôÇ

My location: White Plains, NY 10605

Adorable foster cat in Ticonderoga, NY needs a home! 

Posted for a friend: 

Travel is wondering, When is it my time for my furever home? 
This senior boy needs someone to love! He's a great boy, he might be 11 yrs old, but he acts so much younger! What's age anyway?  just a number! 
He loves to get in boxes, watch birds and lay in the sunshine. He likes other cats, laid back ones or he'd be great as an only pet! No dogs please and he prefers older children! 
Who can give this handsome boy the best home he deserves?
